pullRequest.body:
Every file importing Mathlib.Init transitively imports this file already, thus having its module docstring and copyright header checked by the `header` linter. This adds the same input to every file *imported in* Mathlib.Init.

Helps with #17556.

---

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

| +100.00% | `Mathlib.Tactic.DeclarationNames` |

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Tactic.Finiteness.Attr | 1 | 18 | +17 (+1700.00%) |
| Mathlib.Tactic.DeclarationNames | 2 | 4 | +2 (+100.00%) |
| Mathlib.Tactic.Linter.DocPrime | 1 | 2 | +1 (+100.00%) |
| Mathlib.Tactic.Linter.GlobalAttributeIn | 1 | 2 | +1 (+100.00%) |
| Mathlib.Tactic.Linter.HashCommandLinter | 1 | 2 | +1 (+100.00%) |
| Mathlib.Tactic.Linter.Multigoal | 1 | 2 | +1 (+100.00%) |
| Mathlib.Tactic.Linter.OldObtain | 1 | 2 | +1 (+100.00%) |
| Mathlib.Tactic.Linter.RefineLinter | 1 | 2 | +1 (+100.00%) |
| Mathlib.Tactic.Linter.Style | 1 | 2 | +1 (+100.00%) |
| Mathlib.Tactic.Linter.UnusedTactic | 2 | 3 | +1 (+50.00%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>8 files</summary> `Mathlib.Tactic.Linter.OldObtain` `Mathlib.Tactic.Linter.Multigoal` `Mathlib.Tactic.Linter.DocPrime` `Mathlib.Tactic.Linter.GlobalAttributeIn` `Mathlib.Tactic.Linter.UnusedTactic` `Mathlib.Tactic.Linter.RefineLinter` `Mathlib.Tactic.Linter.HashCommandLinter` `Mathlib.Tactic.Linter.Style`</details>|1|
| `Mathlib.Tactic.DeclarationNames` `Mathlib.Tactic.Linter.Lint`|2|
| `Mathlib.Tactic.Finiteness.Attr`|17|

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Since I doubt that the `Header` import is going to be used for importing any function other than the linter, maybe it makes sense to add the file to the part of shake where the files that are globally ignored go, so that then it does not need to be shaken out in every individual import.
I don't feel strongly about this - if you think this is useful, I'm happy to do that instead.
Actually: yes, that seems like a nice simplification - and #18281 will flag any new files which import just the Header linter, so this is not likely to regress unintendedly. Changed.

Thanks!

maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by adomani.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11662001141/job/32467455099)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11662001141/job/32467455363)
Thanks for the reviews!

Thanks!

bors r+

Thanks!

bors r+

EDIT: maybe I'm confused about this.  This goes the other way!  I still would like to make sure that `aesop` did not make it into `Init` anyway!

---

This means that all of `aesop` will be imported in `Init`: maybe there should be a wider discussion about this.

(In fact, I'm not sure that `aesop` has not already been imported with `finiteness`, actually.)
I can confirm; I think you have it packwards: this file imports Mathlib.Init (now), and it imports aesop (and did before this PR).

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: import the `header` linter in all files imported in Mathlib.Init
